title: Computational Neuroscience & Neuroengineering
description:
This series of 4 capsule modules will cover:
1) quantitative methods to study information encoding and decoding in
     the responses of single neurons and of populations of neurons
2) neural network models of learning, including back-propagation, radial basis    
     functions, Hebbian plasticity, spike-time-dependent plasticity, and liquid
     state machines
3) non-invasive recording methods in humans for brain-computer interfaces,
    including EEG and fMRI; and
4) signal processing methods for brain-computer interfaces used in neural  
     prostheses for paraplegics and to rehabilitate stroke patients.
